page.title: 01TOUR OF THE AREA
page.content: WE DID A TOUR OF THE COMPLETE AREA IN OUR SCHOOL BUS. MOST OF THE TIME WE SEEMED TO BE PASSING THROUGH FARMING LAND BOTH ARABLE AND PASTURE. WE DIDN'T SEE ANY SHEEP BUT THERE WERE A FEW HORSES AND COWS IN THE FIELDS. WE ALSO PASSED THROUGH THE DOVECLIFFE AND WOMBWELL WOODS WHERE THE NEW SPRING LEAVES AND BLUEBELLS MADE THEM LOOK VERY ATTRACTIVE. THE HOUSING ESTATES WERE MOSTLY COUNCIL HOUSES INCLUDING BUNGALOWS, AND SOME PRIVATE RESIDENCES WERE SCATTERED AROUND. THE CENTRE OF WOMBWELL WAS VERY BUSY WITH SHOPPERS AND TRAFFIC. AWAY FROM THE SHOPS EVERYWHERE LOOKED DRAB EXCEPT WHERE SPRING FLOWERS AND BLOSSOMS WERE BLOOMING. WE SAW SWOME SMALL FACTORIES IN WOMBWELL BUT ONLY ONE MINE. COAL MINING IS THE MAIN INDUSTRY AND THE RESULTRANT GRIME COULD BE SEEN EVERYWHERE.
